history.content:
Do you also have to get a certain grade in CS 70 or 61C? Because I would say the second combo. would be more difficult. (61C workload > 61B workload and CS 70 difficulty > EE16B difficulty). If your grade in those classes doesn't matter, then maybe do the second combo.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Considering the semester, I would actually say the exact opposite. 61B, especially with the heavy project version of the class, is greater workload than 61C and CS 70 is comparable to 16B, but maybe a little less workload considering the 16B labs.

Do you also have to get a certain grade in CS 70 or 61C? Because I would say the second combo. would be more difficult. (61C workload > 61B workload and CS 70 difficulty > EE16B difficulty). If your grade in those classes doesn't matter, then maybe do the second combo.

Hey
I am planning on switching to EECS and as a result need to get a minimum of B+ in CS61B and EECS 16B this semester. 
I was wondering if I should take Physics 7B along with those two classes or if it would be easier to take Physics 7B in Fall 2020 with CS61C and CS70!

Thank you in advance!
history.subject: CS61B + EECS 16B + Physics 7B or CS61C + CS70 + Physics 7B
